Instrument.name: Radio Science Subsystem
Instrument.description: The Lunar Prospector Radio Science investigations utilized instrumentation with elements on the spacecraft and at the DSN. Much of this was shared equipment, being used for routine telecommunications as well as for Radio Science. The performance and calibration of both the spacecraft and tracking stations directly affected the radio science data accuracy, and played a major role in determining the quality of the results. The spacecraft part of the radio science instrument is described immediately below; that is followed by a description of the DSN (ground) part of the instrument. The radio science experiment that was conducted with Lunar Prospector was a radio tracking experiment in which the magnitude and direction of the planet's gravity field were derived from the Doppler (and, sometimes, ranging) measurements.
